page.title: 05Place Names
page.content: Goring used to be called Garinges in the original Domesday Book and at one time it was called Little Nottingham.Cleeve's name means cliff of clift meaning the cutting of the channel by the force of the stream.Crays Pond gets it's name from a British river name the same as with Crai in Wales.Crai comes from the word fresh and clean.That's were Crays Pond gets it's name from.Hayfield Shaw is in the block as well it means open land where grass grew.And Shaw means Copse.Grove means thicket and there is a tiny bit of Grove on the map. Gatehampton means by a gate.
